args.natural_language_statement:
The fundamental group of any compact, path connected, and locally simply connected topological space is finitely generated.

Formalize as a Lean4 statement (no proof) with Mathlib imported. Use a hypothesis for local simple connectivity: for every x there exists an open neighborhood U containing x such that the subspace U (as a subtype) is simply connected. State the conclusion as: there exists a finite set S of elements of the fundamental group (at some basepoint x0) whose subgroup closure is the whole fundamental group. End the theorem with := by sorry.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Lean Meta Elab Tactic
open MessageData
def ppAC (ccs : CCState) : MessageData := sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Set

theorem fundamental_group_finitely_generated_of_compact_path_connected_locally_simply_connected
  (X : Type _) [TopologicalSpace X] [CompactSpace X] [PathConnectedSpace X]
  (hloc : ∀ x : X, ∃ U : Set X, IsOpen U ∧ x ∈ U ∧ SimplyConnectedSpace {y : X | y ∈ U}) :
  ∀ x0 : X, ∃ S : Set (FundamentalGroup X x0),
    Set.Finite S ∧ Subgroup.closure (S : Set (FundamentalGroup X x0)) = (⊤ : Subgroup (FundamentalGroup X x0)) := by
  sorry
